definition.name: NXcg_half_edge_data_structure

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: d
symbol.doc: The dimensionality, which has to be at least 2.

definition.doc:
Computational geeometry description of a half-edge data structure.
Such a data structure can be used to efficiently circulate around faces and iterate over vertices of a planar graph.

field.name: vertex_identifier_offset
field.doc: In this half-edge data structure vertex identifiers start at 1. Vertices are identified with consecutive integers up to number_of_vertices. This field can be used to document which constant integer has to be added to another set of vertex_identifier to assure that these other identifiers also start at 1.

field.name: face_identifier_offset
field.doc:
In this half-edge data structure face identifiers start at 1. Faces are identified with consecutive integers up to number_of_faces. This field can be used to document which constant integer has to be added to another set of face_identifier to assure that these other identifiers also start at 1.
The face identifier zero is reserved for the NULL face !

field.name: half_edge_identifier_offset
field.doc: In this half-edge data structure half-edge identifiers start at 1. Half-edges are identified with consecutive integers up to number_of_half_edges. This field can be used to document which constant integer has to be added to another set of half_edge_identifier to assure that these other identifiers also start at 1.

field.name: face_half_edge
field.doc: Identifier of the (starting)/associated half-edge of the face.

field.name: half_edge_vertex_origin
field.doc: The identifier of the vertex from which this half-edge is outwards pointing.

field.name: half_edge_twin
field.doc: Identifier of the associated oppositely pointing half-edge.

field.name: half_edge_incident_face
field.doc: If the half-edge is a boundary half-edge the incident face identifier is NULL, i.e. 0.

field.name: weinberg_vector
field.doc:
Users are referred to the literature for the background of L. Weinberg's work about topological characterization of planar graphs:
* `L. Weinberg 1966a, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1109/TCT.1964.1082216>`_ * `L. Weinberg, 1966b, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1137/0114062>`_ * `E. A. Lazar et al. <https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevLett.109.095505>`_
and how this work can e.g. be applied in space-filling tessellations of microstructural objects like crystals/grains.
